The risks of 100% certainty

“The mistake is investing 100-percent certainty in a result and not holding a probabilistic view of scientific truth or risk and benefit. When people are making decisions for their own well-being, they need to hold that uncertainty in mind.” Catherine Kerr.

The same goes for investing 0-percent certainty in something. Chadwick Matlin
